intro: Hymenodictyon louhavate, commonly known as the African buttercup, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical Africa and is characterized by its showy yellow flowers and palmate leaves. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, winged seeds. Hymenodictyon louhavate is often found in moist, well-drained soils in woodland or savanna habitats.
